Isn't the regioselectivity of hydroboration driven by the electropositive nature of boron versus hydrogen (causing the delta minus hydrogen to end up on the more electrophilic site), rather than the difference in size?

Hydroboration does not mean “adding water using boron”; it refers, unsurprisingly, to adding a hydrogen and a boron. We use the term for additions of HBR2 even when not following up with oxidation, e.g. when preparing boron species for cross-coupling.
